skillTree.localised_description: Duneskulk and Vilewind share a volatile bond of dominance and mutual benefit, with the wyvern's feral savagery tempered by its warlord rider's mastery... as well as Warpstone-laced meat.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: Furtive, scheming, sly, cunning, underhand, devious, conniving, double-dealing, and sneaky - valuable traits if you wish to stay alive!
All Skaven are unprincipled and untrustworthy by their foul natures. However, this is rarely a disadvantage in the face of the enemy.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Duneskulk earned his name by always being where enemies thought he wasn't. Even others amongst his own clan cannot keep track of their leader if he desires to slip away.

target_if: Not on or below a platform

ui_effects.localised_text: Creates an image of Duneskulk Skreekblade

skillTree.localised_description: Duneskulk Skreekblade can summon a swirling sandstorm to cloak his movements and those of his allies, providing them with enhanced stealth and making it difficult for enemies to target them. Incidentally, it makes it very easy for Clan Gnaw to steal from their foes.

effects.description:
Attribute: Stalk during hills battles
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

effects.description:
Attribute: Unspottable during hills battles
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.

effects.description:
Attribute: Unspottable during desert battles
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.

effects.description:
Attribute: Stalk during desert battles
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

effects.description:
Attribute: Stalk during wasteland battles
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

effects.description:
Attribute: Unspottable during wasteland battles
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.

skillTree.localised_description: Skreekblade excels at singling out vulnerable enemies. This ability allows him to mark a target, increasing the damage dealt to that specific foe for a brief period, making him a deadly threat to high-priority targets.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: Calling upon the desert to aid him, Skreekblade brings up a massive sandstorm that traps and buries his opponents beneath its clawing grasp.
Above all, Clan Gnaw is focused on capturing and selling creatures to other, richer, Skaven. And that's something that Duneskulk needs his best rats to do.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +10%

Melee Attack: +3 for Big Game Hunter, Ambush Netter, and Boar Wrangler units
	(Lord's army)

Melee Defence: +3 for Big Game Hunter, Ambush Netter, and Boar Wrangler units
	(Lord's army)
Magic item drop chance from battle: +20%

Melee Attack: +6 for Big Game Hunter, Ambush Netter, and Boar Wrangler units
	(Lord's army)

Melee Defence: +6 for Big Game Hunter, Ambush Netter, and Boar Wrangler units
	(Lord's army)
Magic item drop chance from battle: +30%

Melee Attack: +10 for Big Game Hunter, Ambush Netter, and Boar Wrangler units
	(Lord's army)

Melee Defence: +10 for Big Game Hunter, Ambush Netter, and Boar Wrangler units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even the image of Duneskulk can be enough to kill anyone who does not understand the dangers of the desert.

target_if: Not on or below a platform

ui_effects.localised_text: Creates an image of Duneskulk Skreekblade

skillTree.localised_description: Whether by attachment or mutation, something nasty and spiky on your tail has got to bring no little advantage in battle.
As you might expect, the forces of order are repelled by the Skaven and their myriad disgusting, disease-ridden ways.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Dwarfs
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Lizardmen
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against High Elves, Lizardmen, Dwarfs and men

skillTree.localised_description: Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.

ui_effects.localised_text: Explosion does not affect friendly troops

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
From out of the dunes comes the deadliest of blows.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Driven into battle by whips and humbled by chains, the only hope of a slave is a glorious death in battle.

effects.description:
Charge Bonus: +3 for Slave units
	(Lord's army)

Charge Bonus: +6 for Slave units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The core of any good army, always willing to serve, always willing to die, so that other more important rats can escape.

effects.description:
Weapon Strength: +5% for Clanrat units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: +10% for Clanrat units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The elite of Clan Gnaw's fighting forces always seem to know when to dodge a blow, and never get tired from hunting big beasts.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -12% for Big Game Hunter, Ambush Netter, and Boar Wrangler units
	(Lord's army)

Physical Resist: +5% for Big Game Hunter, Ambush Netter, and Boar Wrangler units
	(Lord's army)

Vigour loss reduction: -25% for Big Game Hunter, Ambush Netter, and Boar Wrangler units
	(Lord's army)

Physical Resist: +10% for Big Game Hunter, Ambush Netter, and Boar Wrangler units
	(Lord's army)

Vigour loss reduction: -50% for Big Game Hunter, Ambush Netter, and Boar Wrangler units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Let the fool-fools get in close. Smart rats fight from range!

effects.description:
Ammunition: +5% for Pig-Sticker, Dunedagger, Captured Rock Lobber, and Captured Spear Chukka units
	(Lord's army)

Missile Strength: +5% for Pig-Sticker, Dunedagger, Captured Rock Lobber, and Captured Spear Chukka units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +10% for Pig-Sticker, Dunedagger, Captured Rock Lobber, and Captured Spear Chukka units
	(Lord's army)

Missile Strength: +10% for Pig-Sticker, Dunedagger, Captured Rock Lobber, and Captured Spear Chukka units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +15% for Pig-Sticker, Dunedagger, Captured Rock Lobber, and Captured Spear Chukka units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Savage predators know little more than a headlong rush into combat. Smart Skaven stay well away when the beasts are crashing into combat.

effects.description:
Melee Attack: +2 for Rat, Scorpion, Wolf, Pig, and Sabretusk units
	(Lord's army)

Melee Attack: +4 for Rat, Scorpion, Wolf, Pig, and Sabretusk units
	(Lord's army)

Melee Defence: +3 for Rat, Scorpion, Wolf, Pig, and Sabretusk units
	(Lord's army)

Melee Attack: +6 for Rat, Scorpion, Wolf, Pig, and Sabretusk units
	(Lord's army)

Melee Defence: +6 for Rat, Scorpion, Wolf, Pig, and Sabretusk units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Wildspeakers of Clan Gnaw have long trained their captured flying units to act as scouts and spotters for the rest of Gnaw's forces.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: 3% for Vulture, Manticore, and Wyvern units
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 6% for Vulture, Manticore, and Wyvern units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +5% for Vulture, Manticore, and Wyvern units
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 12% for Vulture, Manticore, and Wyvern units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Vulture, Manticore, and Wyvern units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: In the vast expanse of the badlands, where danger lurks around every dune and crag, Clan Gnaw's finest hunters know the rule - always get the drop on the opponent, no matter the cost.

effects.description:
Magic Resist: +20% for Clanrat, Big Game Hunter, Ambush Netter, and Boar Wrangler units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Bonus vs Large: +8 for Clanrat, Big Game Hunter, Ambush Netter, and Boar Wrangler units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: From a far distant ridgetop comes a shower of bolts and boulders, the only sign that Clan Gnaw's ranged corps is active.

effects.description:
Reload time reduction: +10% for Pig-Sticker, Dunedagger, Captured Rock Lobber, and Captured Spear Chukka units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +10% for Pig-Sticker, Dunedagger, Captured Rock Lobber, and Captured Spear Chukka units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Slave, beast, it's of no mind to the Overseers and Wildspeakers of Clan Gnaw. Send them in and let them let rush the enemy.

effects.description:
Physical Resist: +15% for Slave, Rat, Scorpion, Wolf, Pig, and Sabretusk units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile Resist: +12% for Slave, Rat, Scorpion, Wolf, Pig, and Sabretusk units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The flight of their prey brings the flying monsters of Clan Gnaw swooping down, intent upon eating their fill of the carrion before the other beasts arrive.

effects.description:
Ward save: 10% for Vulture, Manticore, and Wyvern units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: 15% for Vulture, Manticore, and Wyvern units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
Keeping on top of things with an iron fist prevents Skavendom from becoming too much of a degenerate mess.
Naturally, rats get in everywhere  even the tiniest opening presents little obstacle  spreading their disease and corruption everywhere they can.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
When making corpses of your foes, leave nothing of value for their kin to recover.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

factionEffects.localised_description: Reviled for their past, Clan Gnaw clings to the production of wormoil and the breeding of verminous creatios, the only things they have left in a harsh world

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +10 with the faction of Clan Moulder
Trapping Pits: Clan Gnaw actively hunts down, traps, and enslaves others who dwell in the Badlands, whether they be Orc, Goblin, or beast.
Melee Defence and Weapon Strength: +3 for Clan Gnaw for each active war against Greenskins

Upkeep: +100% for all non-Gnaw units
	(all armies)

Recruitment cost: +100% for all non-Gnaw units
	(all armies)
Construction cost: +100% for all non-Gnaw military buildings

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The desert wastes of the Badlands are blessed cover for the rats of Clan Gnaw. At least, they are when Duneskulk is leading them, for he has a sixth sense at navigating through the wastes.

effects.description:
Leadership: +8 when fighting in desert battles
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +8 when fighting in wasteland battles
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +8 when fighting in hills battles
	(Lord's army)

Attribute: Vanguard Deployment during desert battles
	(Lord's army)
